data.title: 2.6 terabyte leak of Panamanian shell company data reveals "how a global industry led by major banks, legal firms, and asset management companies secretly manages the estates of politicians, Fifa officials, fraudsters and drug smugglers, celebrities and professional athletes."
Revealed: the $2bn offshore trail that leads to Vladimir Putin
#Panamapapers see Iceland's Prime Minister faced with calls for a snap election. The Icelandic Pirate Party have an overwhelming lead in the polls.

Japan is witnessing a record number of compensation claims related to death from overwork, or “karoshi”, a phenomenon previously associated with the long-suffering “salary man” that is increasingly afflicting young and female employees.
Taliban app removed from Google Play Store following investigation by The Foreign Desk

Fears for 1,000 missing children in illegal UK faith schools. Education authority 'destroyed incriminating records relating to pupils at risk of sexual abuse' in ultra-Orthodox Jewish schools.
